content.title: Mahila Samridhi Yojana under NSKFDC- Haryana
content.department: Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC)
content.beneficiary: Women Safai Karamcharis and their dependents
content.details: The scheme 'Mahila Samridhi Yojana under NSKFDC' is implemented by the Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC) in collaboration with the National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC). This scheme offers loans up to ₹1,00,000/- to women Safai Karamcharis or their dependents for economic development through self-employment initiatives, such as establishing cloth shops, dairies, tea shops, bangle shops, beauty parlours, papad making, basketry, tailoring shops, etc. The Corporation contributes margin money at 10% of the project cost.
benefits: Loans of up to ₹1,00,000/- per beneficiary/unit for various economic development activities.
Margin money @ 10% of the project cost.
Subsidy @ 50% of the total project cost (Maximum amount of subsidy is ₹10,000/-).
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The applicant should be a female.
The applicant's age should be between 18 and 55 years.
The applicant should be either a woman Safai Karamchari or a dependent daughter of Safai Karamchari.
documents_required: Safai Karamchari or dependent of Safai Karamchari Certificate issued by the competent authority

faqs.question: Who implements the Mahila Samridhi Yojana?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation (HSFDC) in collaboration with the National Safai Karamcharis Finance & Development Corporation (NSKFDC).

faqs.question: What is the maximum loan amount provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The maximum loan amount provided under this scheme is ₹1,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What types of self-employment initiatives are eligible for this loan?
faqs.answer: Eligible self-employment initiatives include cloth shops, dairies, tea shops, bangle shops, beauty parlours, papad making, basketry, tailoring shops, and similar activities.

faqs.question: What is the margin money contribution by the Corporation?
faqs.answer: The Corporation contributes margin money amounting to 10% of the project cost.

faqs.question: Is there any subsidy provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Corporation provides a subsidy of 50% of the total project cost, with a maximum amount of ₹10,000.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the subsidy?
faqs.answer: The subsidy is provided only to beneficiaries living below the poverty line.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for applying to this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana, female, aged between 18 and 55 years, and either a Safai Karamchari or a dependent of one. There is no income limit.

faqs.question: How can one apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply online through the official portal Antyodaya-SARAL Portal or the official website of NSFDC.
